HostsPerVlan hosts_per_vlan

Detailed Description

A NetworkConfigurator to handle vlans on initialization.

Not many parameters available... What it actually does is to take the 10.x.x.0/24 subnet for each vlan. 10.0.0.0/24 is always going to be the real device. the x.x is replaced by the vlan ID. DrawBack: This means that each vlan is allowed 254 machines(hosts+network devices).

Member Typedef Documentation

void VlanNetConfig::assignAddresses ( cTopology &  topo,
NodeInfoVector &  nodeInfo 
) [protected, virtual] 

00028                                                                             {
00029     // assign IP addresses
00030     uint32 networkAddress = IPAddress("10.0.0.0").getInt();
00031     uint32 netmask = IPAddress("255.255.255.0").getInt();
00032     int maxNodes = (~netmask)-1;  // 0 and ffff have special meaning and cannot be used
00033     //if (topo.getNumNodes()>maxNodes)
00034     //    error("netmask too large, not enough addresses for all %d nodes", topo.getNumNodes());
00035 
00036     int numIPNodes = 0;
00037     for (int i=0; i<topo.getNumNodes(); i++)
00038     {
00039         // skip bus types
00040         if (!nodeInfo[i].isIPNode)
00041             continue;
00042 
00043         uint32 addr = networkAddress | uint32(++numIPNodes);
00044         nodeInfo[i].address.set(addr);
00045 
00046         // find interface table and assign address to all (non-loopback) interfaces
00047         IInterfaceTable *ift = nodeInfo[i].ift;
00048         for (int k=0; k<ift->getNumInterfaces(); k++)
00049         {
00050             InterfaceEntry *ie = ift->getInterface(k);
00051             if (!ie->isLoopback())
00052             {
00053                 string ifname = ie->getFullName();
00054                 int subif = ifname.find('.');
00055                 int vlan=0;
00056                 if (subif!=string::npos){
00057                         vlan = atoi(ifname.substr(subif+1).c_str());
00058                 }
00059 
00060                 HostsPerVlan::iterator it = hosts_per_vlan.find(vlan);
00061                 if (it == hosts_per_vlan.end()){
00062                         hosts_per_vlan[vlan] = 1;
00063                 }else{
00064                         if (hosts_per_vlan[vlan] == 254)
00065                                 error("netmask too large, not enough addresses for all nodes "
00066                                                 "for vlan %d", vlan);
00067                         hosts_per_vlan[vlan]++;
00068                 }
00069                 uint32_t vl = vlan&0x00FFL;
00070                 uint32_t vh = vlan>>8;
00071                 vh=vh<<8*2;
00072                 vl=vl<<8;
00073                 addr=networkAddress|vh|vl|hosts_per_vlan[vlan];
00074 
00075                 ie->ipv4Data()->setIPAddress(IPAddress(addr));
00076                 ie->ipv4Data()->setNetmask(netmask);
00077                 // full address must match for local delivery
00078             }
00079         }
00080     }
00081 }

void VlanNetConfig::setDisplayString ( cTopology &  topo,
NodeInfoVector &  nodeInfo 
) [protected, virtual] 

00084 {
00085     int numIPNodes = 0;
00086     for (int i=0; i<topo.getNumNodes(); i++)
00087         if (nodeInfo[i].isIPNode)
00088             numIPNodes++;
00089 
00090     // update display string
00091     char buf[100];
00092     sprintf(buf, "%d IP nodes\nin %d vlans\n(%d non-IP nodes)", numIPNodes, (int)hosts_per_vlan.size(),topo.getNumNodes()-numIPNodes);
00093     getDisplayString().setTagArg("t",0,buf);
00094 }
